qas.question: Each tradition has its own core what?
there are common concepts to both major buddhist branches according to what organization?

context: Not all traditions of Buddhism share the same philosophical outlook, or treat the same <a0_0>concepts<a0_0/> as central. Each tradition, however, does have its own core concepts, and some comparisons can be drawn between them. For example, according to one <a1_0>Buddhist ecumenical organization<a1_0/>,[web 23] several concepts common to both major Buddhist branches:
